definition:
Suffocated; choked. Shak.

1. To choke or kill by stopping respiration; to stifle; to smother. Let not hemp his windpipe suffocate. Shak. 2. To destroy; to extinguish; as, to suffocate fire.

To become choked, stifled, or smothered. "A swelling discontent is apt to suffocate and strangle without passage." collier.
